```{.r .cell-code}
library(skimr)
library(ggthemes)
```
:::


## Loading in Data set


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
spotify_all <- read_csv('https://bcdanl.github.io/data/spotify_all.csv')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Rows: 198005 Columns: 7
â”€â”€ Column specification â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): playlist_name, artist_name, track_name, album_name
dbl (3): pid, pos, duration_ms

â„¹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
â„¹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
spotify_all
```

## The Artists for the Ten Most Popular Songs


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
Q1a <- spotify_all %>% 
  arrange(-`duration_ms`) %>% 
  filter(playlist_name != "Audiobooks") %>% 
  slice_head(n = 10) %>% 
  select(`artist_name`)

Q1a
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 10 Ã— 1
   artist_name          
   <chr>                
 1 Sound Dreamer        
 2 Best of 9JA          
 3 Late Night Tales     
 4 Grandmaster Flash    
 5 Brian Eno            
 6 Reggae Mix USA       
 7 Eric Thomas          
 8 D.VELOPED            
 9 Deftones             
10 Jonathan David Helser
```
:::
:::


## The Five Most Common Artists in the Data Frame ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¨


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
Q1b <- spotify_all %>% 
  group_by(`artist_name`) %>% 
  summarise(count = n()) %>% 
  arrange(-count) %>% 
  slice_head(n = 5)

Q1b
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 5 Ã— 2
  artist_name    count
  <chr>          <int>
1 Drake           2715
2 Kanye West      1065
3 Kendrick Lamar  1035
4 Rihanna          915
5 The Weeknd       913
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = Q1b)+
  geom_col(mapping = aes(x = artist_name,
                             y = count,
           color = artist_name))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Spotify_Blog_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


As we can see Drake is very Popular ğŸµ

### Most popular songs by each of the 5 most popular artists


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
Q1b2 <- spotify_all %>% 
  group_by(`track_name`, `artist_name`) %>%
  filter(`artist_name` %in% Q1b$artist_name) %>% 
  summarise(po_song = n()) %>% 
  arrange(-po_song)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'track_name'. You can override using the
`.groups` argument.
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
answer <- Q1b2 %>% 
  group_by(`artist_name`) %>% 
  filter(po_song == max(po_song)) %>% 
  unite(Name_and_Track, track_name, artist_name, sep = ",")

answer
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 5 Ã— 2
  Name_and_Track         po_song
  <chr>                    <int>
1 One Dance,Drake            143
2 HUMBLE.,Kendrick Lamar     142
3 Starboy,The Weeknd         100
4 Gold Digger,Kanye West      83
5 Needed Me,Rihanna           79
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = answer)+
  geom_col(mapping = aes(x = Name_and_Track,
                         y = po_song,
  color = Name_and_Track))+
ylab("Song Occurences")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Spotify_Blog_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
